Biography

My name is Guanghui Min (pronunciation: /ɡwɑːŋ-hweɪ mɪn/), a first-year Computer Science Ph.D. student at University of Virginia. I am very fortunate to be advised by Professor Chen Chen.

My current interests focus on Graph data mining and theory, network analysis as well as their applications in epidemiology, financial markets and so on.

I completed my Master's degree in Applied Statistics at the University of Michigan, Ann Arbor in 2020, supervised by Professor Kerby Shedden. Prior to that, I earned my Bachelor's degree in Statistics from the School of Mathematics and Statistics at Wuhan University. I worked as a full-time Senior Machine Learning Engineer at the Innovation Center of Yinhua Fund Management Co., Ltd, a leading public fund (with an AUM exceeding 1 trillion CNY, as of 2021) in mainland China from 2020 to 2024.

Miscellaneous

In my spare time, I am a boxer, a boxing coach, and a boxing referee. My favorite active boxers include Dmitry Bivol, Gennady "GGG" Golovkin, and Naoya "Monster" Inoue. I also greatly admire retired greats like Mike Tyson, Muhammad Ali, and Roy Jones Jr. I'm deeply drawn to the passion, bravery, resilience, and strategic wisdom of boxers.

I started boxing in 2020 and I'm honored to be trained by Mr. Shengming Huang. I'm a certified Intermediate A Coach by the Beijing Boxing Association (BBA) [certificate] and a professional referee certified by the World Boxing Buddies Union (WBBU) [certificate]. I also maintain a GitHub repo that covers the fundamentals of boxing techniques and my own reflections on the sport.

If you're also interested in boxing matches and the sport, feel free to discuss it with me!!!
